msDesc.head: Burchardus Anerbe de Argentina, Summa de paenitentia seu de casibus conscientiae. Germany, s. xiv1/4.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1272–1276. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Burchardus Anerbe de Argentina
msItem.title: Summa de poenitentia seu de casibus conscientiae
msItem.note: (pr.: .: Lyon, 1510; – Quétif–Échard, SOP, 1. 466b; Schulte, GQ, 2. 423f.; J. Dietterle, ‘Die Summae confessorum (sive de casibus conscientiae) – von ihren Anfängen an bis zu Silvester Prierias ...’, ZKG 25 (1904) 248–72, at pp. 268–72; Little 235; Stelling-Michaud 78; Michaud-Quantin, Sommes, 42; Kaeppeli 706, citing the present MS.; K. Pennington, ‘Summae on Raymond de Pennafort’s “Summa de casibus” in the Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Munich’, Traditio 27 (1971) 471–80, at p. 472; Bloomfield 5744, and suppl.; see also 1361, 2719 & 5748).

supportDesc.support: parchment; stitching in natural-coloured thread preserved on fols 46, 59 & 62 only, (fols 35 & 55) remnants of it (stitching holes). Three bookmarks made of parchment strips glued to the outer margins of fols 28 (sic), 49 & 83 to indicate the beginning of bks 2–4.
supportDesc.collation: i 12-2 | ii–v 10 | vi 10-2 | vii & viii 8 | ix 10-2 | x 10-1 | xi 8. A parchment slip incorporated between fols 12/13, the stub between fols 18/19.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in ink (fols 29v–30r: lead point), two columns of 30–34 (typically 31) lines. Ruled space c.144–53 106–118

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiv1/4, by a single hand; the parchment slip incorporated between fols 12/13 written in the text hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Flourished initials in red and blue.
Coloured initials in red and blue.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper right-hand margin of fol. 1r, immediately following the header, which was written in a different hand of s. xivex, employing one-compartment a only and likely from the Mainz Charterhouse, too (the same hand added a note at the head of fol. 83r referring to the table of chapters (bk 4) at the end of the volume): ‘...et est Cartusiensium prope mogunciam’.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 349 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 54

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1272–1276

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
